Known as "psychological and behavioural symptoms of dementia" (BPSD)

Present in over 80% of patients with Alzheimer's disease or other dementias. Early onset.

           Negative symptomatology: withdrawal and apathy 50% prevalence

Frequent psychotic symptoms: delusions, hallucinations

question.title: What is the estimated prevalence of psychobehavioural symptoms of dementia (BPSD) in patients with Alzheimer's disease or other dementias?

option_a.title: 90% of patients
option_a.description: A commonly cited estimate, but not the correct answer

option_b.title: Over 80% of patients
option_b.description: The correct answer, according to the text

option_c.title: Early onset is a characteristic of BPSD
option_c.description: A plausible but incorrect statement about BPSD

option_d.title: Negative symptomatology is the most common type of BPSD
option_d.description: A partially correct statement, but not the most common type

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
